sen.j: 五番町（ごばんちょう）は京都市上京区にある町名である。
sen.e: Goban-cho is the name of a town which is situated in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 「五番町」の町名の由来は安土・桃山時代、豊臣秀吉が聚楽第を築城する際、かつて平安宮が存在し野原と化した「内野」を開発し武家地として整備した。
sen.e: Around here, there once existed Heian-kyu Palace, but the palace site, which was called "Uchino," became overgrown with weeds, and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, when he built Jurakudai near here, developed and improved Uchino as the samurai residence in Azuchi Momoyama Period, and this is the origin of "Goban-cho."

sen.e: The Heian-kyu Palace once stood here, but the palace site, known as "Uchino," was overgrown with weeds, and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, developed and improved Uchino when he built Jurakudai near the area, as the samurai residence in Azuchi Momoyama Period, creating the origin of "Goban-cho."

sen.j: しかし、住処を伏見の桃山城に移すと内野は荒廃し、田畑に返った。
sen.e: But after Hideyoshi moved his residence to Momoyama-jo Castle in Fushimi, Uchino was again overgrown with weeds and was turned into fields.

sen.j: 再開発をされたのが江戸時代初期、御所拡大に伴い移住してきた住民が北野天満宮、愛宕山への参拝客を相手に煮売茶屋をはじめ、それが花街として発展してゆくのである。
sen.e: Goban-cho was redeveloped in early Edo Period, when people moved in, with "Gosho" (the imperial palace) enlarged, and they began their "Niuri-jaya" (tea houses selling boiled vegetables, fish and beans) for visitors to go to Kitano Tenmangu Shrine or Mount Atago, and in later days, these shops changed their business and the area formed the geisha quarter.

sen.j: 明治に入り、五番町は四番町とともに独立の遊廓として認められ女紅場を設置したが有名無実となり、やがて東部と西部に分けられ、東部は芸妓、西部は娼妓とそれぞれ栄えた。
sen.e: In Meiji Era, Goban-cho was permitted as an independent prostitution district along with Yonban-cho, and "Nyokoba" (Women's School) was set up there, but Nyokoba became a nominal institution, and Goban-cho was divided into two, that is, the eastern area to have fun with geisha girls & the western area to have an intercourse with a prostitute.

sen.j: 特に芸妓部は祇園甲部、先斗町と並ぶ芸所として名を馳せていた。
sen.e: Especially, the eastern area was a well-known entertainment district, along with Gion Ko-bu and Ponto-cho.

sen.j: しかし、近くには上七軒があり、五番町は職人が通う花街としてのイメージが抱かれたため、発展解消され娼妓本位の街となった。
sen.e: But there existed Kamihichiken nearby, so people had the impression that Goban-cho, in contrast, was the geisha quarter mainly for craftsmen, so Goban-cho was reorganized into the town that centered on the business of prostitution.

sen.j: さらに名前自体が下級花街のイメージが付きまとわれ業者側は「北新地」と呼ばせていたが、地元の人は相変わらず「ごばんちょう」と呼んだ。
sen.e: In addition, the name itself gave the impression that the town was a low-level geisha quarter, so people related to the geisha business began to call it "Kitashinchi," but local people still called it "Goban-cho."

sen.e: After World War Ⅱ, the town was renamed "Nishijin Shinchi," and the business of prostitution continued for a while, but it ended on March 15, 1958, when Anti-Prostitution Law went into effect.
